bestBHT.bht: Great multitudes followed Jesus, drawn by the healing and instruction that he offered. These multitudes came from various regions, including Galilee, the country beyond Jordan, and the coasts of Judea. Jesus taught and instructed in divine knowledge, confirming his teachings through miracles. He healed those who were sick and diseased, wherever they followed him. This aligns with what is mentioned in John 10:41-42, and it introduces the topic of divorce, which Jesus addresses in his teachings.

Henry Alford: 2.] This agrees with what is said John x. 41, 42. For healed, St. Mark has taught.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: And great multitudes followed him; and he healed them there."
What we now have on the subject of divorce is some of that teaching."
Philip Schaff: And the people resort to him again, and, as he was wont, he taught them again.
This assumes that He was already on the way toward Jerusalem, when the Pharisees came.
John Gill: And great multitudes followed him... these came not only from Galilee, but from the adjacent parts, from the country beyond Jordan, and the coasts of Judea..."
...he taught and instructed in the knowledge of divine things, and confirmed his doctrines by miracles.
He healed them there; in the above mentioned places, even as many of them as were sick and diseased.
John Wesley: Multitudes followed him, and he healed them there — That is, wheresoever they followed him.

bhtAttempts.bht: Great multitudes followed Jesus as he traveled, seeking healing and instruction. This aligns with what is mentioned in John 10:41-42. Jesus taught and instructed in divine knowledge, confirming his doctrines with miracles. These multitudes came from various regions, including Galilee, the country beyond Jordan, and the coasts of Judea. Wherever they followed Jesus, he healed those who were sick and diseased. This passage introduces the topic of divorce, which is further discussed in the teachings of Jesus.

Great multitudes followed Jesus, seeking healing and divine instruction. These multitudes came not only from Galilee, but also from the adjacent regions of the country beyond Jordan and Judea. Jesus taught and confirmed his doctrines through miracles, healing those who were sick and diseased wherever they followed him. This aligns with what is said in John 10:41-42 and introduces the topic of divorce, which Jesus further addresses in his teachings.

Jesus taught and confirmed his doctrines through miracles, healing those who were sick and diseased wherever they followed him. This aligns with what is said in John 10:41-42. Jesus' teachings on divorce were a significant part of his instruction during this time.
